title: Luminary Exhibition Celebration: Camille Claudel
short_description: Join us for an exclusive celebration of French sculptor Camille Claudel, whose defiance of the social expectations of her time brought about some of the most powerful explorations of the human form in European history.
description:
Join us for an exclusive celebration of French sculptor Camille Claudel, whose defiance of the social expectations of her time brought about some of the most powerful explorations of the human form in European history.

This event will include an open bar, light bites, and music following a curator-led exploration of how Claudel's fame has made her the subject of a variety of books, films, and even a musical. Camille Claudel will be open for your viewing throughout the evening.

Valet and coat check will be available at the Modern Wing Entrance (159 E. Monroe).

ABOUT THE CURATOR

Emerson Bowyer is Searle Curator, Painting and Sculpture of Europe, at the Art Institute of Chicago. A specialist in 18th- and 19th-century French and British art, he has previously worked at the Frick Collection, the Fine Arts Museums of San Francisco, and the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York. His exhibitions include David d’Angers: Making the Modern Monument (Frick Collection, 2013), Luminous Worlds: British Works on Paper 1760-1900 (Fine Arts Museums of San Francisco, 2015), and Like Life: Sculpture, Color, and the Body (Met Breuer, 2018), for which he was co-curator. Emerson is currently at work on Canova: Sketching in Clay, an exhibition of Antonio Canova's rare and unforgettable clay sketches.
